title: Kingdom

properties.name: description
properties.value: Various kingdoms, city-states and other polities exist throughout Gielinor, generally inhabited and ruled predominantly by one race.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:KingdomThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Kingdom
 This article or section requires a cleanup in order to meet the Old School RuneScape Wiki's quality standards.
You can edit this page to improve it.
This article is about the concept of kingdoms in Gielinor. For the music track, see Kingdom (music track). For the activity of gathering resources from the Kingdom of Miscellania, see Managing Miscellania.

Various kingdoms, city-states and other polities exist throughout Gielinor, generally inhabited and ruled predominantly by one race.

Many of these polities are monarchies ruled by a king, while others have a governing structure such as a council or republic. Some civilisations have unspecified forms of government, and not all domains have clearly defined borders.

Contents

  • 1 States
    • 1.1 Human states
    • 1.2 Non-human states
    • 1.3 Regions with an unspecified form of government
    • 1.4 Historical states
    • 1.5 Otherworldly states
  • 2 Notes

States[edit | edit source]

Human states[edit | edit source]

  • Kingdom of Misthalin
    • Capital: Varrock
    • Leader: King Roald III
  • Kingdom of Asgarnia
    • Capital: Falador
    • Leader: King Vallance (de jure) Sir Amik Varze (de facto)
  • Kingdom of Kandarin (partial)
    • Capital: East Ardougne
    • Leader: King Lathas Ardignas (King Thoros after King Lathas is executed during the Ardougne Revolution)
  • Kingdom of Kandarin (partial)
    • Capital: West Ardougne
    • Leader: King Tyras Ardignas (assassinated during the events of Regicide quest)
    • Notes: King Ulthas divided Kandarin into two parts, one for each of his sons; Lathas was bequeathed the eastern half of Ardougne and Tyras the western half. It is never specified how the rest of the kingdom was apportioned, although Tyras has effective control of the Port Tyras encampment and wields legal authority over West Ardougne.
  • Emirate of Al Kharid
    • Capital: Al Kharid
    • Leader: The Emir
  • Menaphos
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: The Pharaoh
  • Sophanem
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: The High Priest of Icthlarin[1]
  • Pollnivneach
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Ali the Mayor
  • Nardah
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Awusah the Mayor
    • Notes: Based on dialogue with Shiratti the Custodian during the Spirits of the Elid quest, the town is at least ecclesiastically subject to Menaphos.
  • Great Kourend
    • Capital: Kingstown
    • Leader: Kourend Council, since the death of King Kharedst IV
  • Varlamore
    • Capital: Civitas illa Fortis
    • Leader: Queen Zyanyi Arkan
  • Miscellania
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: King Vargas, with the player character acting as regent after the events of Throne of Miscellania
  • Etceteria
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Queen Sigrid
  • Jatizso
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: King Gjuki Sorvott IV
  • Neitiznot
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Burgher Mawnis Burowgar
  • Rellekka
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Brundt the Chieftain
  • Moon Clan
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: None[2], though the player character is directed to the Oneiromancer in order to broker a peace deal between the Moon Clan and the Fremenniks of Rellekka.
  • Shilo Village
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Unknown
  • Tai Bwo Wannai
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Timfraku
  • Mountain Tribe
    • Leader: Hamal the Chieftain
  • Bedabin Nomads
    • Leader: Al Shabim

Non-human states[edit | edit source]

  • Morytania, ruled by Vampyres. Largely populated by humans, ghosts, and werewolves.
    • Capital: Darkmeyer
    • Leader: Lord Drakan
  • Tirannwn, ruled by Elves.
    • Capital: Prifddinas
    • Leader: during the Elven Civil War, Lord Iorwerth controls Iorwerth Camp and the entrance to the abandoned Prifddinas, while the rebels rule Lletya and King Tyras rules Port Tyras; after the events of Song of the Elves, eight elven clan leaders rule Tirannwn jointly
  • Ape Atoll, ruled by monkeys.
    • Capital: Marim
    • Leader: King Awowogei
  • Dwarven Realm, ruled by dwarves.
    • Capital: Keldagrim
    • Leader: The Consortium
  • Zanaris, ruled by fairies.
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Fairy Queen; during the events of Fairytale I - Growing Pains, the Fairy Godfather takes de facto control of Zanaris
  • Gnome Stronghold
    • Leader: King Narnode Shareen
  • Tree Gnome Village
    • Leader: King Bolren
  • Dorgesh-Kaan, ruled by Dorgeshuun (cave goblins).
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Ur-tag (elected)
  • Weiss, ruled by ice trolls
    • Capital: City-state
    • Leader: Mother; succeeded by Snowflake after the events of Making Friends with My Arm
  • Zul-Andra
    • Leader: High Priestess Zul-Harcinqa

Regions with an unspecified form of government[edit | edit source]

  • Gu'Tanoth and the Feldip Hills, inhabited by ogres. The existence of multiple ogre chieftains suggests a decentralised society.
  • Troll Stronghold and the rest of the Troll Country to the south of Weiss: inhabited by trolls.
  • Mor Ul Rek: inhabited by the TzHaar.
  • Mount Karuulm: inhabited by the Kahlith, guided if not ruled by the Tasakaal.
  • Entrana: presumably ruled by the high priest; possibly part of Asgarnia.
  • Port Phasmatys: forcibly vassalised by the Vampyres until its inhabitants were turned to ghosts by Necrovarus, who is the de facto ruler. Its current political relationship to the vampyres is unspecified.
  • Wilderness: a region dominated by anarchy. Various small settlements are scattered across the land, mainly consisting of human outlaws from other lands.

Historical states[edit | edit source]

  • Crandor: a city-state that was destroyed 30 years before the present by the dragon Elvarg.
  • Zarosian Empire: a large empire ruled by the god Zaros. After Zaros was assassinated by Zamorak, his empire was completely destroyed in the resulting God Wars.
  • the Lordship of North Coast off the northern coast of Morytania. Its last lord, Rologarth, was killed by his own doctor, who took over the castle and sold his body to werewolves.
  • Hallowvale: a Saradominist kingdom in what is now Morytania. It was conquered by the Vampyres under Lord Drakan during the God Wars.
  • Baxtorian's kingdom: an elven kingdom east of the Galarpos Mountains. It collapsed in the Fourth Age as its inhabitants left to fight in the Elven Civil War.

Otherworldly states[edit | edit source]

  • Britain
    • Leader: King Arthur (absent)
  • Fisher Realm
    • Leader: Fisher King (Sir Percival after Holy Grail)

Notes[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ According to the Wanderer during Icthlarin's Little Helper
  2. ^ According to Meteora during Lunar Diplomacy

{{otheruses2|the concept of kingdoms in Gielinor|the music track|Kingdom (music track)|the activity of gathering resources from the Kingdom of Miscellania|Managing Miscellania}}
Various '''kingdoms''', '''city-states''' and other polities exist throughout [[Gielinor]], generally inhabited and ruled predominantly by one [[race]].

Many of these polities are monarchies ruled by a king, while others have a governing structure such as a council or republic. Some civilisations have unspecified forms of government, and not all domains have clearly defined borders.

==States==
===Human states===
*Kingdom of [[Misthalin]]
**Capital: [[Varrock]]
**Leader: [[King Roald|King Roald III]]

*Kingdom of [[Asgarnia]]
**Capital: [[Falador]]
**Leader: [[King Vallance]] (''de jure'') [[Sir Amik Varze]] (''de facto'')

*Kingdom of [[Kandarin]] (partial)
**Capital: [[East Ardougne]]
**Leader: [[King Lathas|King Lathas Ardignas]] ([[King Thoros]] after King Lathas is executed during the [[Ardougne Revolution]])

*Kingdom of [[Kandarin]] (partial)
**Capital: [[West Ardougne]]
**Leader: [[King Tyras|King Tyras Ardignas]] (assassinated during the events of [[Regicide]] quest)
**Notes: [[King Ulthas]] divided Kandarin into two parts, one for each of his sons; Lathas was bequeathed the eastern half of Ardougne and Tyras the western half. It is never specified how the rest of the kingdom was apportioned, although Tyras has effective control of the [[Port Tyras]] encampment and wields legal authority over West Ardougne.

*Emirate of [[Al Kharid]]
**Capital: [[Al Kharid]]
**Leader: [[The Emir]]

*[[Menaphos]]
**Capital: [[Menaphos|City-state]]
**Leader: [[The Pharaoh]]

*[[Sophanem]]
**Capital: [[Sophanem|City-state]]
**Leader: The [[High Priest (Sophanem)|High Priest of Icthlarin]]<ref>According to the [[Wanderer]] during [[Icthlarin's Little Helper]]</ref> 

*[[Pollnivneach]]
**Capital: [[Pollnivneach|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Ali the Mayor]]

*[[Nardah]]
**Capital: [[Nardah|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Awusah the Mayor]]
**Notes: Based on dialogue with [[Shiratti the Custodian]] during the [[Spirits of the Elid]] quest, the town is at least ecclesiastically subject to [[Menaphos]].

*[[Great Kourend]]
**Capital: [[Kingstown]]
**Leader: [[Kourend Council]], since the death of [[King Kharedst IV]]

*[[Varlamore]]
**Capital: [[Civitas illa Fortis]]
**Leader: [[Zyanyi Arkan|Queen Zyanyi Arkan]]

*[[Miscellania]]
**Capital: [[Miscellania|City-state]]
**Leader: [[King Vargas]], with the [[player character]] acting as regent after the events of [[Throne of Miscellania]]

*[[Etceteria]]
**Capital: [[Etceteria|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Queen Sigrid]]

*[[Jatizso]]
**Capital: [[Jatizso|City-state]]
**Leader: [[King Gjuki Sorvott IV]]

*[[Neitiznot]]
**Capital: [[Neitiznot|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Mawnis Burowgar|Burgher Mawnis Burowgar]]

*[[Rellekka]]
**Capital: [[Rellekka|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Brundt the Chieftain]]

*[[Moon Clan]]
**Capital: [[Lunar Isle|City-state]]
**Leader: None<ref>According to [[Meteora]] during [[Lunar Diplomacy]]</ref>, though the player character is directed to the [[Oneiromancer]] in order to broker a peace deal between the Moon Clan and the Fremenniks of Rellekka.

*[[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]]
**Capital: [[Shilo Village (location)|City-state]]
**Leader: Unknown

*[[Tai Bwo Wannai]]
**Capital: [[Tai Bwo Wannai|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Timfraku]]

*[[Mountain Tribe]]
**Leader: [[Hamal the Chieftain]]

*[[Bedabin Nomad]]s
**Leader: [[Al Shabim]]

===Non-human states===
*[[Morytania]], ruled by [[Vampyres]]. Largely populated by humans, ghosts, and werewolves.
**Capital: [[Darkmeyer]]
**Leader: [[Lord Drakan]]

*[[Tirannwn]], ruled by [[Elves]].
**Capital: [[Prifddinas]]
**Leader: during the [[Elven Civil War]], [[Lord Iorwerth]] controls [[Iorwerth Camp]] and the entrance to the abandoned [[Prifddinas]], while the rebels rule [[Lletya]] and [[King Tyras]] rules [[Port Tyras]]; after the events of [[Song of the Elves]], eight [[elven clan leader]]s rule Tirannwn jointly

*[[Ape Atoll]], ruled by [[monkeys]].
**Capital: [[Marim]]
**Leader: [[King Awowogei]]

*[[Dwarven Realm]], ruled by [[dwarves]].
**Capital: [[Keldagrim]]
**Leader: [[The Consortium]]

*[[Zanaris]], ruled by [[Fairy|fairies]].
**Capital: [[Zanaris|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Fairy Queen]]; during the events of [[Fairytale I - Growing Pains]], the [[Fairy Godfather]] takes ''de facto'' control of Zanaris

*[[Gnome Stronghold]]
**Leader: [[King Narnode Shareen]]

*[[Tree Gnome Village]]
**Leader: [[King Bolren]]

*[[Dorgesh-Kaan]], ruled by [[Dorgeshuun]] (cave goblins).
**Capital: [[Dorgesh-Kaan|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Ur-tag]] (elected)

*[[Weiss]], ruled by [[ice troll]]s
**Capital: [[Weiss|City-state]]
**Leader: [[Mother]]; succeeded by [[Snowflake]] after the events of [[Making Friends with My Arm]]

*[[Zul-Andra]]
**Leader: [[High Priestess Zul-Harcinqa]]

===Regions with an unspecified form of government===
*[[Gu'Tanoth]] and the [[Feldip Hills]], inhabited by [[ogre]]s. The existence of multiple [[ogre chieftain]]s suggests a decentralised society.
*[[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]] and the rest of the [[Troll Country]] to the south of Weiss: inhabited by [[troll]]s.
*[[Mor Ul Rek]]: inhabited by the [[TzHaar]].
*[[Mount Karuulm]]: inhabited by the [[Kahlith]], guided if not ruled by the [[Tasakaal]].
*[[Entrana]]: presumably ruled by the [[High Priest (Entrana)|high priest]]; possibly part of [[Asgarnia]].
*[[Port Phasmatys]]: forcibly vassalised by the Vampyres until its inhabitants were turned to ghosts by [[Necrovarus]], who is the ''de facto'' ruler. Its current political relationship to the vampyres is unspecified. 
*[[Wilderness]]: a region dominated by anarchy. Various small settlements are scattered across the land, mainly consisting of human outlaws from other lands.

===Historical states===
*[[Crandor]]: a city-state that was destroyed 30 years before the present by the dragon [[Elvarg]].
*[[Zarosian Empire]]: a large empire ruled by the god [[Zaros]]. After Zaros was assassinated by [[Zamorak]], his empire was completely destroyed in the resulting [[God Wars]].
*the [[Lord of the North Coast|Lordship of North Coast]] off the northern coast of [[Morytania]]. Its last lord, [[Lord Rologarth|Rologarth]], was killed by [[Dr Fenkenstrain|his own doctor]], who took over the castle and sold his body to werewolves.
*[[Hallowvale]]: a Saradominist kingdom in what is now Morytania. It was conquered by the [[Vampyres]] under [[Lord Drakan]] during the [[God Wars]].
*[[Baxtorian]]'s kingdom: an elven kingdom east of the [[Galarpos Mountains]]. It collapsed in the [[Fourth Age]] as its inhabitants left to fight in the [[Elven Civil War]].

===Otherworldly states===
*[[Britain]]
**Leader: [[King Arthur]] (absent)

*[[Fisher Realm]]
**Leader: [[Fisher King]] ([[Sir Percival]] after [[Holy Grail]])

==Notes==
